casebody.data:
Burgess v. Eaton, appellant. Payment—appropriation of. The plaintiff paid defendant $400 of her own money, which she directed to apply upon a mortgage held by him against a house owned by her husband The defendant did not so apply it, but applied it upon a general indebted ness of the husband to him. H. J. Thomas, for appellant. Q. Van Voorhees, for respondent. E. D. Smith, J.

Held, that plaintiff could recover back the amount so misappropriated.

Appeal from a judgment in favor of the plaintiff upon a report of a referee. ■ .
